Class GmmlLine

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--GmmlLine
public class GmmlLine
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains the lines. It contains a constructor, and the methods contains, setLocation and getHelpers

Constructor Summary
GmmlLine(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy, int type, int style, java.awt.Color color)
          Constructor GmmlLine has 4 doubles for the coordinates, 2 ints for the type and the style and a color object for the color as input.
 
Method Summary
 boolean contains(double pointx, double pointy)
          Method contains uses the coordinates of a specific point (pointx, pointy) to determine whether a line contains this point.
 java.awt.Rectangle[] getHelpers(double zf)
          Method getHelpers returns an array of rectangles on the line, which are used to drag and transform the line.
 void setLocation(double startx, double starty)
          Method setLocation changes the int x and y coordinate to the x and y that are arguments for this method
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

GmmlLine

public GmmlLine(double startx,
                double starty,
                double endx,
                double endy,
                int type,
                int style,
                java.awt.Color color)
Constructor GmmlLine has 4 doubles for the coordinates, 2 ints for the type and the style and a color object for the color as input.

Method Detail

contains

public boolean contains(double pointx,
                        double pointy)
Method contains uses the coordinates of a specific point (pointx, pointy) to determine whether a line contains this point. To do this, a polygon is created, on which the normal contains method is used. This polygon is created to enlarge the line, because it is rather difficult to click a line.

setLocation

public void setLocation(double startx,
                        double starty)
Method setLocation changes the int x and y coordinate to the x and y that are arguments for this method

getHelpers

public java.awt.Rectangle[] getHelpers(double zf)
Method getHelpers returns an array of rectangles on the line, which are used to drag and transform the line.
